result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jerome J Castona

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jerome J Castona in court with attorney Sean Patrick Drury. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
All files heard: 11CF387, 13CF273 Status on 14CF81, 14CF82

Atty Cousins indicates the victim is present and would like to make a statement. 
M.D. makes statements to the Court. 

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Drury makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant makes statements to the Court. 

BY THE COURT: 
11CF387 Count 1 - 
Sentence withheld.  Placed on probation for a period of 3 years:
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Get all prescriptions from same pharmacy. 
Psychological evaluation and comply with treatment recommendations. 
AODA if not had one in the past 12 months & comply with treatment recommendations, if there are any. 
(Court does not order Domestic Abuse Alternative Program).
No abusive contact with Michelle Dombrowski. 
Sign releases of information for all treatment providers so agent can monitor the conditions of probation. 
Pay costs.  
0 days pre-trial incarceration credit. 

14CF81 and 14CF82 are dismissed and read-in. 

13CF273 Count 1 - 
Imposed and Stayed - 60 days jail.
Placed on probation for a period of 24 months, concurrent: 
Comply with all conditions set forth in 11CF387. 
Pay costs. 

13CF273 Count 1 - 
Sentence withheld.  Placed on probation for a period of 3 years, concurrent:
Comply with all conditions set forth in 11CF387.
Pay costs.

Parties retain their copies of the PSI confidentially in their files.
Status conference on April 1, 2014 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Jerome J Castona in court with attorney Sean Drury. Veronica Fay Isherwood appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
3:17 p.m. case is called and appearances stated ont the record.
14CF81 & 14CF82
Court writes in the number on the written waiver form.
Defendant waives right to Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions the Defendant regarding Waiver of Preliminary Hearing.

Court finds the Defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the Preliminary Hearing.
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over. 

Bond Continued  Status conference scheduled for April 1, 2014 at 02:00 pm.
Arraignment:
State files Information.
Defendant's atty received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information thru his attorney. 
Not Guilty Plea entered to each count.
Bond Continued

14CF82
Arraignment:
State files Information.
Defendant's atty received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information thru his attorney. 
Not Guilty Plea entered to each count.

Bond is ordered continued.
3:20 p.m. case is adjourned.  Status conference scheduled for April 1, 2014 at 02:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on March 10, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Jerome J Castona in court with attorney Sean Drury. David Raymond Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Cases 14CF81 and 14CF82 heard today for initial appearances. Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
Bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 10, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
$1,000 sig bond:  Comply with any outstanding bond he is under.

DA Case #14PT289
  Court calls case at   2:06 p.m.
ADA  appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.
Atty Drury present.
ADA  states facts for anticipated charges of Bail Jump-fel.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court questions the defendant.
State request a    Comply with current bond for pending cases.

BTC:  $1,000 sig bond:  Comply with any outstanding bond he is under.
